meanings.definition: The quality of being easily upset or bothered.
meanings.sent1: Her fussiness over small things made it hard to please her.
meanings.sent2: The baby's fussiness kept the parents up all night.
meanings.sent3: The fussiness of the cat over its food was quite amusing to watch.
meanings.sent4: His fussiness about cleanliness was like a bright red flag waving in the air.
meanings.sent5: The fussiness of the old man was as noticeable as a loud horn in a quiet room.

meanings.definition: Excessive attention to detail or unnecessary concern.
meanings.sent1: The fussiness of the chef in the kitchen was legendary.
meanings.sent2: Her fussiness about grammar made her the go-to person for proofreading.
meanings.sent3: The fussiness of the robot in checking every detail was quite comical.
meanings.sent4: His fussiness in arranging the flowers was like a painter meticulously creating a masterpiece.
meanings.sent5: The fussiness of the tailor in fitting the suit was as precise as a surgeon's scalpel.
